definition: house with more than 1 story/storied building/floor/CL:層|层[ceng2],座[zuo4],棟|栋[dong4]
between/among/within a definite time or space/room/section of a room or lateral space between two pairs of pillars/classifier for rooms
gap/to separate/to thin out (seedlings)/to sow discontent

sentences.english: “What's in the yellow door next to the green stairwell?” Julia asked.
sentences.chinese: “樓梯間旁邊的黃門裏有什麼？”茱莉亞問。

sentences.english: Lily runs into her in the stairwell one day.
sentences.chinese: 一天，李莉在樓梯間偶然碰到新拌進來的女孩。

sentences.english: While I was watching out for debris, I fell down a staircase.
sentences.chinese: 當我在注意墜物的時候，我從樓梯間摔了下來。

sentences.english: Floors were enlarged by adding a new stairwell at one end of the building.
sentences.chinese: 各樓層通過在建築一端增加的新樓梯間得以擴展。

sentences.english: The staircase leads to the two floor and white wooden.
sentences.chinese: 樓梯間和通往二樓的是白色木門。

sentences.english: For example, stairwells often played a central role in Hitchcock dramas.
sentences.chinese: 例如，樓梯間往往發揮着核心作用，希區柯克電視劇。

sentences.english: Since this staircase is rather dark, we must feel our way carefully.
sentences.chinese: 既然此樓梯間卮雒黑暗，我們必須感覺閂逶小心地。

sentences.english: The assailant fled down a nearby stairwell.
sentences.chinese: 兇犯趁機逃進了附近的一個樓梯間。

sentences.english: The staircase has been changed to double control lamp.
sentences.chinese: 樓梯間的燈已經改成雙控。
每層樓梯間應安裝應急燈。

sentences.english: What’s in the yellow door next to the green stairwell?
sentences.chinese: 樓梯間旁邊的黃門裏有什麼？

sentences.english: SCULLY begins looking in other rooms and stairwells .
sentences.chinese: 史高麗開始看其他的房間和樓梯間。

definition: head of a flight of stairs
to act with confusion/to be in a flurry/to be flustered
window with an iron grating (apartment etc)/barred window of a prison cell
to glare like a tiger watching his prey (idiom)/to eye covetously
attendant on an airplane, train, boat etc
to rant and rave/to be scared, upset (Beijing dialect)
